text: Carol Emshwiller (April 12, 1921 â€“ February 2, 2019) was an American writer. She was known for her avant garde short stories and science fiction novels. She won the Nebula Award and the Philip K. Dick Award. Emshwiller was born in Ann Arbor, Michigan. Her best known novel was The Mount. Emshwiller died on February 2, 2019 at her daughter's home in Durham, North Carolina, aged 97. ==References== ==Other websites== *2011 radio interview at The Bat Segundo Show Category:1921 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American feminist writers Category:American science fiction writers Category:Writers from Michigan Category:People from Ann Arbor, Michigan
title: Carol Emshwiller
